Class Games

  • java.lang.Object
    • Games
  • public class Games
extends java.lang.Object
    The Games class contains methods pertaining to the action of playing the game and checking if words placed on the board are valid words in the dictionary and based on Scrabble rules.
    Author:
    (Maya Vora and Max McEvoy)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Games()
      Creates the tile bag where all of the extra character tiles are kept for players to draw.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canMakeMove​(Users currentUser, Turn turn, Gameboard board)
      Runs tests to see if the user can make the move they are trying to by checking whether or not the user has the correct tiles, is in bounds of the board, if it's their turn, if the user's word is touching another word, and if the user is placing their word across the center piece if it's the first turn.
      int changeTurn()
      Changes whose turn it is to make their move.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> checkConnectedWords​(java.lang.String userWord, int row, int col, int direction, Gameboard board)
      Creates an ArrayList of the words that are connected together after the user has placed their word on the board (the words that are formed after the first move).
      static void createDictionary()
      Creates the scrabble dictionary by reading the dicitonary file and adding all the words into an arraylist called wordList.
      void createNewUsers()
      Takes input from user and creates a player based on the name they entered.
      void createTileBag()
      Initiates the tile bag with the correct amount of letter tiles from which players will draw from.
      void displayTiles​(Users user)
      Displays the current players tiles.
      static int getActiveTurn()
      Getter method that retrieves the active turn.
      void giveTiles​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> emptyTray)
      Gives the players their 7 tiles randomly by using a random number generator.
      static boolean isValid​(java.lang.String userWord)
      Checks if the word that the user entered is an actual word in the dictionary.
      void playGame​(int activeTurn, Gameboard board)
      Runs the game Scrabble.
      void replaceAllTiles​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> emptyTray)
      Replaces the users tiles if they want a fresh tray of letters.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • createTileBag

        public void createTileBag()
        Initiates the tile bag with the correct amount of letter tiles from which players will draw from.

        Gives the players their 7 tiles randomly by using a random number generator.
        Parameters:
        emptyTray - The user's tiles.

      • replaceAllTiles

        public void replaceAllTiles​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> emptyTray)
        Replaces the users tiles if they want a fresh tray of letters.
        Parameters:
        emptyTray - The user's tiles.

      • displayTiles

        public void displayTiles​(Users user)
        Displays the current players tiles.
        Parameters:
        user - The current player's tiles being displayed.

      • createDictionary

        public static void createDictionary()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the scrabble dictionary by reading the dicitonary file and adding all the words into an arraylist called wordList.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs while reading the file.

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid​(java.lang.String userWord)
        Checks if the word that the user entered is an actual word in the dictionary.
        Parameters:
        userWord - The word that the user entered.
        Returns:
        true if it is an actual word and false if it's not.

      • playGame

        public void playGame​(int activeTurn,
                     Gameboard board)
        Runs the game Scrabble.
        Parameters:
        activeTurn - Indicates whichever player's turn it is.
        board - The board in which the game is being played on.

      • changeTurn

        public int changeTurn()
        Changes whose turn it is to make their move.
        Returns:
        The current turn.

      • getActiveTurn

        public static int getActiveTurn()
        Getter method that retrieves the active turn.
        Returns:
        The current turn.

      • createNewUsers

        public void createNewUsers()
        Takes input from user and creates a player based on the name they entered.

      • canMakeMove

        public boolean canMakeMove​(Users currentUser,
                           Turn turn,
                           Gameboard board)
        Runs tests to see if the user can make the move they are trying to by checking whether or not the user has the correct tiles, is in bounds of the board, if it's their turn, if the user's word is touching another word, and if the user is placing their word across the center piece if it's the first turn.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - The player whose turn it is.
        turn - The directions for the word to be placed and checked.
        board - The gameboard being played on and being changed.
        Returns:
        True if the word can be placed and false if it can't and fails the tests.

      • checkConnectedWords

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> checkConnectedWords​(java.lang.String userWord,
                                                                 int row,
                                                                 int col,
                                                                 int direction,
                                                                 Gameboard board)
        Creates an ArrayList of the words that are connected together after the user has placed their word on the board (the words that are formed after the first move).
        Parameters:
        userWord - The word being examined that was entered by the user.
        row - The row the word being examined starts in.
        col - The column the word being examined starts in.
        direction - The direction the user entered.
        board - The scrabble board being examined.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the connected words.
